name: Global Plastic Waste Accumulation Crisis with Policy Interventions
description: Simulation of plastic waste accumulation over 50 years with multiple intervention scenarios including production caps and recycling improvements

assumptions: Current global plastic production: 400 million tonnes annually
3% annual growth in plastic production without intervention
80% of plastic persists in the environment long-term
70% of plastic waste ends up in oceans
100,000 kg of plastic per sq km creates visible surface coverage
Cleanup costs estimated at $1,000 per tonne
Environmental damage costs scale exponentially with coverage
Production caps limit growth to 1.5x initial production after year 10
Recycling improvements can reach 50% rate starting year 5
outputs: Earth surface coverage progression over 50 years
Economic costs of cleanup and environmental damage
Critical threshold years (1% coverage, 10% ocean coverage)
Scenario comparison: baseline vs production caps vs recycling vs combined
key_insights: Reveals timeline until critical environmental tipping points
Quantifies economic benefits of early intervention
Shows effectiveness of production limits vs recycling improvements
Demonstrates exponential nature of environmental damage costs
